statements: SELECT * FROM employee_performance_data ORDER BY employee_name ASC;
SELECT employee_name, performance_score FROM employee_performance_data WHERE performance_score > 80;
SELECT employee_name, training_needs FROM employee_performance_data WHERE training_needs IS NOT NULL;
SELECT * FROM employee_performance_data WHERE employee_id = 3;
SELECT employee_name, performance_score FROM employee_performance_data ORDER BY performance_score DESC;
SELECT * FROM employee_performance_data WHERE performance_score > 80 ORDER BY employee_name ASC;
SELECT employee_name, performance_score FROM employee_performance_data WHERE training_needs IS NOT NULL ORDER BY performance_score DESC;
SELECT employee_name, training_needs FROM employee_performance_data WHERE performance_score BETWEEN 70 AND 90 ORDER BY employee_id;
SELECT * FROM employee_performance_data WHERE training_needs LIKE '%development%' ORDER BY performance_score ASC, employee_id DESC;
SELECT employee_id, employee_name FROM employee_performance_data WHERE performance_score < 60 ORDER BY employee_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM employees;
SELECT employee_name, department FROM employees;
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department = 'HR';
SELECT employee_name, hire_date FROM employees ORDER BY hire_date DESC;
SELECT employee_name, performance_rating FROM employees WHERE performance_rating > 4;
SELECT employee_id, employee_name, department FROM employees WHERE performance_rating > 3;
SELECT * FROM training_logs WHERE training_duration >= 60 ORDER BY training_date DESC;
SELECT employee_name, department, hire_date FROM employees WHERE department = 'IT' ORDER BY hire_date ASC;
SELECT DISTINCT department FROM employees;
SELECT employee_name, training_topic, training_duration FROM employees INNER JOIN training_logs ON employees.employee_id = training_logs.employee_id ORDER BY training_duration DESC;
SELECT * FROM employees ORDER BY employee_name DESC;
SELECT employee_name, salary FROM employees WHERE department='IT';
SELECT employee_name, performance_rating FROM employees WHERE salary > 50000;
SELECT employee_name, department FROM employees WHERE performance_rating < 3 ORDER BY department;
SELECT employee_id, employee_name, salary FROM employees WHERE performance_rating = 5;
SELECT employee_name, department, salary FROM employees WHERE performance_rating > 4 ORDER BY salary DESC
SELECT employee_name, department, performance_rating FROM employees JOIN performance_trends ON employees.employee_id = performance_trends.employee_id WHERE trend_date >= '2022-01-01'
SELECT employee_name, department, AVG(salary) AS avg_salary FROM employees GROUP BY department HAVING AVG(salary) > 50000

SELECT employee_name, performance_rating, training_topic FROM employees JOIN training_needs ON employees.employee_id = training_needs.employee_id WHERE training_date < CURRENT_DATE ORDER BY training_date ASC
SELECT employee_id, COUNT(*) AS training_count FROM training_needs GROUP BY employee_id HAVING COUNT(*) > 2 ORDER BY training_count DESC
SELECT * FROM employees
SELECT first_name, last_name, hire_date FROM employees WHERE department_id = 2
SELECT * FROM performance_reviews WHERE employee_id = 123 ORDER BY review_date DESC
SELECT review_text FROM performance_reviews WHERE performance_rating > 3
SELECT employee_id, training_type, training_date FROM training_needs ORDER BY training_date
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE department_id = 1 ORDER BY hire_date DESC
SELECT first_name, last_name, hire_date FROM employees WHERE hire_date >= '2021-01-01' AND hire_date < '2022-01-01'
SELECT employee_id, first_name, last_name, department_id FROM employees WHERE first_name LIKE 'J%' ORDER BY last_name
SELECT employee_id, COUNT(*) AS review_count FROM performance_reviews GROUP BY employee_id HAVING COUNT(*) >= 3
SELECT employee_id, MAX(performance_rating) AS highest_rating FROM performance_reviews GROUP BY employee_id HAVING MAX(performance_rating) >= 4
SELECT * FROM employee_performance
SELECT employee_id, performance_score, performance_trend FROM employee_performance ORDER BY performance_score DESC
SELECT department_name, employee_id FROM employee_department JOIN department_data ON employee_department.department_id = department_data.department_id WHERE department_name = 'IT'
SELECT * FROM employee_training WHERE training_duration > 2
SELECT reviewer_name, review_comments FROM performance_review
SELECT * FROM employee_performance ORDER BY performance_score DESC LIMIT 5
SELECT employee_id, performance_score, training_needs FROM employee_performance WHERE training_needs LIKE '%advanced%'
SELECT review_id, employee_id, review_date, reviewer_name FROM performance_review WHERE review_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-12-31'

SELECT employee_id, performance_score, training_needs FROM employee_performance INNER JOIN employee_department ON employee_performance.employee_id = employee_department.employee_id WHERE employee_department.department_id = 5
SELECT employee_id, AVG(performance_score) AS avg_score FROM employee_performance GROUP BY employee_id HAVING AVG(performance_score) > 80
